comments:
Driver:  WTP 1.5 RC4

1. Create a Web project "tc1" targetting Tomcat 5.0.  
2. Put a Java bean in that project.
3. Create Web service from that Java bean.
4. In page 1 of the Web service wizard, lclick the "tc1" link to enter a different project "tc2".  

Click OK resulted in the error:

IWAB0014E Unexpected exception occured.
  
      java.lang.NullPointerException
      at org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.conformance.JDTResolver.isConstructable(JDTResolver.java:100)
      at org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.conformance.rules.JAXRPCRule0001.visitClass(JAXRPCRule0001.java:56)
      at org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.conformance.JavaWebServiceRuleSet.visitClass(JavaWebServiceRuleSet.java:181)
      at org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.conformance.JAXRPCWebServiceRuleEngine.analyzeServiceClass(JAXRPCWebServiceRuleEngine.java:79)
      at org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.conformance.JAXRPCWebServiceRuleEngine.analyze(JAXRPCWebServiceRuleEngine.java:65)
      at org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.conformance.JAXRPCWebServiceAnalyzer.analyze(JAXRPCWebServiceAnalyzer.java:86)
      at org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.conformance.JAXRPCWebServiceAnalyzer.analyze(JAXRPCWebServiceAnalyzer.java:109)
      at org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.axis.creation.ui.command.BUAxisInputCommand.execute(BUAxisInputCommand.java:76)

Dismiss the error and click Next again resulted in:

IWAB0014E Unexpected exception occured.
  
      java.lang.NullPointerException
      at org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.conformance.rules.JAXRPCRule0005.visitClass(JAXRPCRule0005.java:66)
      at org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.conformance.JavaWebServiceRuleSet.visitClass(JavaWebServiceRuleSet.java:181)
      at org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.conformance.JAXRPCWebServiceRuleEngine.analyzeServiceClass(JAXRPCWebServiceRuleEngine.java:79)
      at org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.conformance.JAXRPCWebServiceRuleEngine.analyze(JAXRPCWebServiceRuleEngine.java:65)
      at org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.conformance.JAXRPCWebServiceAnalyzer.analyze(JAXRPCWebServiceAnalyzer.java:86)
      at org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.conformance.JAXRPCWebServiceAnalyzer.analyze(JAXRPCWebServiceAnalyzer.java:109)
      at org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.axis.creation.ui.command.BUAxisInputCommand.execute(BUAxisInputCommand.java:76)

Created an attachment (id=43654)
Patch fix to org.eclipse.jst.ws.

The problem occurs because the JAX-RPC analyzer attempts to load the JDT IType object for the service class from a project under which the class is not loadable, and quietly chokes on the resulting null JDT IType later on in its logic.

The attached patch fixes the problem by catching the unloadable class prior to the true analyzer getting dispatched, and produces a much better message than an NPE to help the user understand the problem.

If for any reason the message change associated with this bug cannot be absorbed for translation reasons, the fix can be simplified slightly to simply have the analyzer quietly return (and for the wizard to deal with the unloadable class further on in its processing), however, it will be much, much better for the end user experience if we can include the proper message included in this fix.

The fix is simple and well tested. Will raise for PMC approval.

David, thanks for your timely approval note.

I might get shot, drawn, quartered and beaten with a rubber hose for this, but in the face of a looming translation cutoff I made a decision to commit and release (tag v200606070357) *JUST* the addition of the completely harmless new message to the .properties file despite the absence of the usual required additional PMC votes.

The remainder of the patch - changes to WSPluginMessages.java and JAXRPCWebServiceAnalyzer - remain uncommitted pending complete approval. If for any reason the above mentioned .properties change is a technical issue, it can of course be easily reverted.

Thanks - CB.
Committed and released under tag v200606080121.
